business.headline: Changing jobs? Check this EPFO update on PF transfersEffective January 2025, the requirement for employer approval in most transfer cases has been eliminated. Previously, PF balance transfers required coordination between source and destination EPFO offices, often causing delays.

E-commerce, crops, data storage top India-US trade deal negotiations: ReportDiscussions will now begin on issues such as market access for US farm goods, India's data localisation rules, and the role of big tech in e-commerce—areas that have previously proved politically sensitive in India.

Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

Apple plans to make all US iPhones in India by 2026: ReportThe said move is part of Apple's long-term plan to reduce its dependence on China, especially after the recent tariff rules announced by US President Donald Trump.

Ather Energy IPO: Check latest GMP as Rs 3,000 crore public listing to open soonThe Ather Energy IPO will be a book-built issue. It consists of a fresh issue of 8.18 crore equity shares worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.11 crore shares worth Rs 354.76 crore.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today despite early gains?Sensex and Nifty plunged more than 1% reacting to uncertainty over geopolitical tensions. The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,026.28 points to 78,775.15, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 330.40 points to 23,916.30 as of 11:41 am.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as markets react to Kashmir terror attackThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 492.29 points to 79,309.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 172.15 points to 24,074.55 as of 10 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will Dalal Street return to winning ways on April 25?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,522 as of 7:48 am, which is about 1.1% above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,246.7.

Stocks to watch today: RIL, Axis Bank, Gensol, IndusInd Bank, Maruti SuzukiReliance Industries will announce its results for the March 2025 quarter today. The market will be watching closely for updates on its energy, telecom, and retail businesses.

ED raids Gensol promoters, detains Puneet Jaggi from Delhi hotel: ReportSources said the probe agency has invoked provisions under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following findings of fund diversion and misrepresentation flagged earlier by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi).

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

Kumar Mangalam Birla to receive Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award 2025The 57-year-old industrialist, Padma Bhushan awardee and Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, is being honoured for his pivotal role in shaping India's growth story.
'Wives are smarter': Harsh Goenka's gold vs gadget lesson goes viralOn April 24, at 10.30 am, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams, up Rs 1,171.

Sensex, Nifty snap 7-day winning streak, HUL falls 4% after Q4 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 315.06 points to 79,801.43 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 82.25 points to settle at 24,246.70.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Gold prices today: Check rates in metro cities. What to expect?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold was priced at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams at 10.30 am, which was a rise of Rs 1,171 from the last close.
ITR filing 2025: Last date, refund timeline and documents. All you need to knowYou can submit your ITR for the year of assessment 2025-26 once the online portal goes live.

Middle-class stuck in debt trap, says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh MukherjeaUsing data from the Reserve Bank of India, Mukherjea estimates that 5-10% of middle-class households are now stuck in a debt trap.

Want to share UPI with family? Check steps to use BHIM app's UPI CircleUPI Circle is a feature where the main UPI account holder or the primary user can authorise up to five trusted people, i.e., secondary users to make UPI payments using his account.
Gensol says no ED notice received by company, stock continues steep fallGensol share price: The stock fell 5% to hit the lower circuit limit and has fallen over 50% in the last 6 months.

HUL Q4 profit falls 4% to Rs 2,464 crore; announces Rs 24 final dividendThe FMCG major reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,464 crore for the March quarter, down 3.7% from Rs 2,558 crore in the same period last year.

Explained: Why Rallis India shares tumbled over 6% after Q4 resultsThe Tata Group company posted a wider net loss of Rs 32 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, compared to Rs 22 crore in the same period last year.

Saving for daughter? Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana still offers high interest. Check ratesSukanya Samriddhi Yojana not only offers high interest but also tax-free returns, thus making it one of the safest savings options for families with a girl child.

UBS upgrades stance on Indian stock markets, but finds China 'more attractive'Despite India's promising fundamentals, China remains UBS's top pick among emerging markets (EM), thanks to cheaper valuations and a stronger risk-reward profile.
Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profit after 7-day market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 159.23 points to 79,957.26, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 72.20 points to 24,256.75 as of 9:28 am.

ICAI to examine books of crisis-hit Gensol Engineering and BluSmartGensol Engineering and BluSmart are currently facing scrutiny after serious questions were raised about their financial dealings and governance practices.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to extend gains beyond 80,000?Sensex, Nifty expectation: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,415.5 at 8:01 am, up 0.3% from Wednesday's Nifty50 close of 24,328.95, signalling a higher opening.

Stocks to watch on April 24: HUL, Nestle, SBI Life, Axis Bank, Adani GreenShares of HUL, Axis Bank, Tech Mahindra, Nestle, Persistent Systems and SBI Life Insurance Company will be closely watched today as the companies are set to announce their fourth quarter earnings.

From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

'Operation Zeppelin' reveals details of Adani's counter to Hindenburg: ReportIn January 2023, Hindenburg published a scathing report against the Adani Group. The counter to its damning report against the conglomerate was dubbed 'Operation Zeppelin'.

European Union fines Apple $570 million, Meta $228 million under new tech lawsThe fines levied on the two American tech giants are likely to stoke tensions with US President Donald Trump, who has threatened to levy tariffs against countries that penalise US companies.

entertainment.headline: Emraan Hashmi calls Adolescence-style show in India a 'logistical nightmare'Emraan Hashmi recently revealed the challenges of producing a show like 'Adolescence' in India, citing its unique format and logistical hurdles.

Bullet Train Explosion review: Spiritual sequel that combines heart and heatReleased-Wed Apr 23, 2025Bullet Train Explosion: The Netflix film is a gripping thriller that focuses on the everyday heroes aboard a rigged Shinkansen and outside of it, rather than the perpetrator's motive. Directed by Shinji Higuchi, the film pays tribute to Japan's railway staff, blending tension with humanity.

Kesari 2 dialogue plagiarised from a poem? Poet shares proofKesari Chapter 2 faces allegations of plagiarism as YouTuber and poet Yahya Bootwala accused the film's writer of copying lines from his poem on 'Jallianwala Bagh' without permission. He shared the proof on social media.

Crazy casting, crazier pairing: How OTT is heralding a bold new chapterOTT platforms are breaking casting norms wide open—bringing underrated actors and wild on-screen pairings to centre stage. On Cinematic Saturday, we are diving deep into the casting revolution you didn't see coming.

Next vacation will be in Kashmir: Suniel Shetty's fearless stance amid attackActor Suniel Shetty encourages citizens to visit Kashmir for their next vacation to boost tourism and counterterrorism, following a deadly attack in Pahalgam.  He emphasises unity and resilience as key responses to fear and hatred.

David Muir honoured at TIME100 Gala, recalls moment with late Pope FrancisDavid Muir was honored at the 2025 TIME100 Gala for his impactful journalism. He reflected on his early career, praised mentors like Diane Sawyer, and will lead ABC's Vatican coverage.

What's coming and going on CBS: 2025–26 renewals, cancellations, and new showsCBS's 2025–26 schedule features renewed hits like NCIS and Ghosts, the end of Blue Bloods and FBI spin-offs, and exciting new entries like Boston Blue and CIA.

Sirens' trailer: New thriller explores power and sisterhoodNetflix's Sirens, starring Julianne Moore, Milly Alcock, and Meghann Fahy, explores power, class, and sisterhood in a gripping thriller set at a beach estate. It premieres May 22.

Ajith Kumar, with son on lap, watches CSK vs SRH match in Chepauk stadiumActor Ajith Kumar attended a cricket match at Chennai's Chepauk Stadium to watch MS Dhoni in action as CSK clashes with SRH. He was present with his family.

Kull trailer: Raisingh siblings at war in Ekta Kapoor's upcoming showJioHotstar has released the trailer for 'Kull - The Legacy Of The Raisingghs'. The series, produced by Balaji Digital, will stream exclusively on the platform from May 2.

Exploring Park Bo-gum's versatility: A star who shines across time and genreSouth Korean actor Park Bo-gum captivated audiences once more with his latest K-drama 'When Life Gives You Tangerines'. His journey from 'Reply 1988' to this latest role showcased his immense talent and versatility.

Zeenat Aman shares pics from hospital, reveals reason behind social media absenceVeteran actor Zeenat Aman has shared a heartfelt update post-hospitalisation, revealing her thoughts on life and social media. She reflects on her journey and the lessons learned during her recovery.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui reacts to Pahalgam attack: There's a lot of anger in usNawazuddin Siddiqui, during a film promotion event, expressed his solidarity with the victims of the Pahalgam attack by wearing a black band, highlighting his deep sense of anger and pain over the incident.

Nakuul-Jankee discuss dal-chawal parenting but their T-shirts steal the showActor Nakuul Mehta and his wife Jankee Parekh discussed their unique 'Dal-Chawal Parenting' approach on their podcast, while their T-shirts featuring characters from 'Sufi and Joker Bhaiya' become the highlight on social media.

Pakistani actor Mahira Khan condemns Pahalgam attack, deletes post laterPakistani actor Mahira Khan expressed her grief over the Pahalgam terror attack on Instagram. However, she deleted the post later.

When Nana Patekar made a producer wash dishes after serving him muttonIn a candid revelation, Paresh Rawal shared an amusing incident involving Nana Patekar and a producer. The story highlighted how Nana made the producer wash dishes after treating him to mutton.

Nani's HIT 3 gets A certificate, film all set for May 1 releaseTelugu star Nani's 'HIT: The Third Case' has cleared censorship with an 'A' certificate. The film is gearing up for a grand release in theatres on May 1.

Vir Das wraps record-breaking Mind Fool world tour, thanks fansVir Das has wrapped up his historic Mind Fool world tour, acclaimed as the largest by an Indian comedian. The tour not only showcased his wit to a global audience but also set the stage for his upcoming projects.

general news.headline: Pak's Shehbaz Sharif breaks silence amid tensions: Prepared for any misadventurePakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said he was ready for a 'neutral and transparent investigation' into the Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 civilians dead.

Farewell, Pope Francis: Humble funeral draws world leaders, massive crowds  Live UpdatesDeparting from centuries-old tradition, the Pontiff will be buried in the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore unlike his predecessors who were buried beneath St Peter's Basilica within the confines of the Vatican.

Video: Pak official makes throat-slitting gesture at Indian protesters in LondonA senior Pakistani Army official mocked Indians protesting against Pahalgam terror attacks - drawing ire from netizens, with many calling the act 'sick,' 'disgusting' and a 'stark reminder of the lack of civility among Pakistan's military and diplomatic figures.'

Vatican snub? Trump put in 'third-tier' seat at Pope Francis's funeralFrom migration to the environment and Gaza, Trump and the late Pope Francis did not see eye to eye on various issues. However, is Trump not being seated in the front row a snub by the Vatican, or simply protocol? Find out

Blood on grass, echoes of massacre: India Today at Pahalgam attack Ground ZeroOn April 22, terrorists infiltrated Baisaran Valley through a specific entry point inside the park, which killed 26 people, most of them tourists. After firing indiscriminately at unarmed tourists, the terrorists escaped through a planned route. In a chilling video, terrorists were seen forcing tourists to kneel before shooting them.

'Unprovoked firing' by Pakistan along LoC in Kashmir, Army retaliates Live UpdatesPakistani troops initiated unprovoked small arms firing along the LoC, prompting a proportionate response from Indian forces. No casualties were reported, and border security remains intact.

Either our water will flow or their blood: Bilawal Bhutto on Indus treaty freezeThe remarks by Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari signals that India's punitive actions, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, after the Pahalgam attack have infuriated Pakistan.

Pak won't remain silent: Sharad Pawar urges caution on Pahalgam retaliationNationalist Congress Party-SP chief Sharad Pawar said any decision by the Centre should be carefully considered as Pakistan won't remain silent.

Houses of 3 more Lashkar terrorists linked to Pahalgam attack blown upOn Tuesday afternoon, five to six terrorists opened fire on a group of tourists in the Baisaran meadow, which is around 5 kms from Pahalgam. The meadow - also known as 'mini Switzerland' - is accessible only by foot or by horseback. The Pahalgam carnage was one of the deadliest civilian attacks in the Kashmir Valley in recent years.

Omar Abdullah 'may be in cahoots' with terrorists: Ex-Congress MLA's big chargeSenior Congress leader Digvijay Singh's brother and former Congress MLA Lakshman Singh, who has also had a stint with the BJP, in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack, claimed that Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah "may be in cahoots" with terrorists.

Kesari 2 dialogue plagiarised from a poem? Poet shares proofKesari Chapter 2 faces allegations of plagiarism as YouTuber and poet Yahya Bootwala accused the film's writer of copying lines from his poem on 'Jallianwala Bagh' without permission. He shared the proof on social media.

Pet obesity is on the rise. Where are hoomans going wrong?For true pet parents, life revolves around keeping their furry friends happy and healthy. But if meals aren't portioned to match their needs, you might unknowingly be putting them at risk of obesity.

Pakistan won't know what's going to hit it, now that Indus Treaty is shelvedUnder the Indus Waters Treaty, India was granted exclusive control over the eastern rivers - Ravi, Beas, and Sutlej - while Pakistan was given rights over the western rivers - Indus, Jhelum and Chenab - despite their origins in Jammu and Kashmir.

Jeffrey Epstein accuser dies by suicide weeks after saying she 'had days to live'Virginia Giuffre, a key survivor who spoke out against Jeffrey Epstein's abuse, has died by suicide at 41 in Australia. Known for her courage, she helped bring Epstein's enablers to justice and inspired many others to share their stories.

E-commerce, crops, data storage top India-US trade deal negotiations: ReportDiscussions will now begin on issues such as market access for US farm goods, India's data localisation rules, and the role of big tech in e-commerce—areas that have previously proved politically sensitive in India.

Toughest man in India? Sukant Singh Suki runs 350 km race in 4 daysMumbai's Sukant Singh Suki became the first Indian to complete three 200-mile ultramarathon races in the world. After his latest run at the Delirious West race in Australia, Suki spoke to IndiaToday.in, narrating his journey, the inspiration and the future of endurance running in India.

Heroes amid horror: Teenagers chose not to flee but to save tourists in PahalgamDuring the terror attack in Pahalgam that claimed 26 lives, teenage sisters Rubeena and Mumtaza from the Gujjar-Bakerwal community emerged as unlikely heroes, rescuing panicked tourists and offering shelter.

Interval walking boosts heart health and helps you reduce weight: What is itInterval walking supports weight loss by boosting metabolism and helping burn more calories compared to steady, slow walking.

India's girls win big at European Girls' Math Olympiad, check out the problemsIndia won four medals at the European Girls' Mathematical Olympiad (EGMO) 2025, finishing at the 12th spot globally. Girls from Mumbai, Kerala, Pune and Kolkata bagged two silver and two bronze medals.

Woman, daughter killed as speeding car crushes 7 outside UP home; 1 detainedA high-speed car ran over seven people sitting outside their house in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur around 11:30 pm on Friday. A mother-daughter duo was killed in the accident, while five others were seriously injured.

War Game: Forward-looking India-Pakistan conflict scenarioThere are numerous escalatory steps available to both India and Pakistan that have never been taken, offering room to innovate militarily while still avoiding nuclear red lines.

sports.headline: CSK need to build for future, with only 5 games left in IPL 2025: KumbleChennai Super Kings need to figure out their stars for the next season of the IPL, said former cricketer Anil Kumble. Kumble's comments came after the Chennai team failed to defend 155 runs vs SRH at home.

Neeraj Chopra to skip Asian Athletics Championships as India name 59-member squadIndia has revealed its squad for the Asian Athletics Championship, scheduled to be held from May 27 to 31 in South Korea. Neeraj Chopra will skip the event to focus on other major competitions, including the NC Classic in Bengaluru.

Watch: MS Dhoni wicket sparks contrasting emotions as Kavya Maran celebrates in ChepaukIPL 2025: While the rest of the Chennai crowd was silenced, SunRisers Hyderabad owner Kavya Maran celebrated MS Dhoni's wicket from the stands. CSK were bowled out for 154 in 19.5 overs on Friday.

Pakistan Women's Nida Dar takes mental health breakPakistan women's all-rounder Nida Dar has taken a break from cricket to address her mental health issues. The 38-year-old last played in the Women's T20 World Cup in the UAE.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
